original: rnam pa thams cad spros pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba'i phyir ro mnyam 'gyur ba yin zhing /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad spros pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba'i phyir ro mnyam 'gyur ba yin zhing /
translated: It is the same in sameness, because all aspects are the pacification of all elaborations.

original: 'dir 'di ni skad cig gcig la mngon par byang chub pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir 'di ni skad cig gcig la mngon par byang chub pa ste /
translated: Here, this is the manifest enlightenment in a single moment.

original: skad cig kho na la 'gro ba thams cad spros pa thams cad dang bral ba la de ltar mngon par byang chub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig kho na la 'gro ba thams cad spros pa thams cad dang bral ba la de ltar mngon par byang chub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In a single moment, all going is free from all elaborations, and that is the manifest enlightenment.

original: gzugs rdzogs pa ni dag pa'o zhes pa /
analyzed: gzugs rdzogs pa ni dag pa'o zhes pa /
translated: The perfect form is pure.

original: de'i bar ma chad du lha'i rnam pa yongs su rdzogs pa ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes so zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de'i bar ma chad du lha'i rnam pa yongs su rdzogs pa ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes so zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The uninterrupted appearance of the deity's form is the gnosis of the utterly pure dharmadhatu.üîΩThis is the meaning.

original: de kho na nyid shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na nyid shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the essence of the gnosis of the utterly pure dharmadhatu.

original: rnam pa ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin rnams //üîΩcho ga bshad pas de zla ba la sogs pa rnams kyis te /
analyzed: rnam pa ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin rnams // cho ga bshad pas de zla ba la sogs pa rnams kyis te /
translated: The aspects are the nature of the five gnoses.
By the explanation of the rite, they are the moon and so forth.üîΩThe beginner, by the imagination of that,

original: dang po pas de lhag par mos pas dang / cung zad yongs su rdzogs pa ni cho ga bshad pa kho nas de'i don cung zad dngos su byed pa las so //
analyzed: dang po pas de lhag par mos pas dang / cung zad yongs su rdzogs pa ni cho ga bshad pa kho nas de'i don cung zad dngos su byed pa las so //
translated: and the slightly complete, by the explanation of the rite itself, make a little of the meaning of that.

original: 'dir rgyu'i ye shes bzhi'i rang bzhin nyid la yang bde ba chen po mos pa pa yod pa kho na ste /
analyzed: 'dir rgyu'i ye shes bzhi'i rang bzhin nyid la yang bde ba chen po mos pa pa yod pa kho na ste /
translated: Here, in the nature of the four causal gnoses, there is only the imagination of great bliss.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di rgyu rdo rje 'dzin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di rgyu rdo rje 'dzin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: For that very reason, this should be called causal Vajradhara.

original: rnam pa lnga mngon par byang chub pa la yang ni bde ba chen po lhag par mos pa ba ste /
analyzed: rnam pa lnga mngon par byang chub pa la yang ni bde ba chen po lhag par mos pa ba ste /
translated: In the manifest enlightenment with five aspects, there is the imagination of supreme bliss.

original: de nyid kyi phyir lha mo dang yang dag par sbyor ba nyid kyis bde ba chen po mngon par byang chub pa yongs su rdzogs pa kho na la rdo rje 'dzin pa bskyed pa'o zhes pas de kho na dngos por na rnam pa lnga mngon par byang chub
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir lha mo dang yang dag par sbyor ba nyid kyis bde ba chen po mngon par byang chub pa yongs su rdzogs pa kho na la rdo rje 'dzin pa bskyed pa'o zhes pas de kho na dngos por na rnam pa lnga mngon par byang chub
translated: Therefore, it is just in the perfection of the manifest enlightenment of supreme bliss by the union with the goddess that Vajradhara is generated. Thus, in reality, there is the manifest enlightenment with five aspects.

original: pa'o // de kho na yang 'dir bdag med ma dang he ru ka'i dkyil 'khor du bstan to //
analyzed: pa'o // de kho na yang 'dir bdag med ma dang he ru ka'i dkyil 'khor du bstan to //

analyzed: bdag med ma'i dkyil 'khor 'dir ni bde ba chen po man ngag las rtogs par bya ba yin gyi /

original: 'di ltar yud kyis mngon du 'gyur ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar yud kyis mngon du 'gyur ba yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not, however, manifest in an instant.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di ni bar ma'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di ni bar ma'i rim pa'o //

analyzed: shes rab dang thabs yang dag par sbyor ba nyid na ni de yongs su gsal lo zhes bde ba chen po 'di nye bar ston to //
translated: When there is the union of wisdom and means, it is clear, and thus this supreme bliss is taught.

original: de nyid kyi phyir yang rgyud gzhan rnams su zla ba la sogs pa'i rim pas rnam pa lnga mngon par byang chub pa gsungs na yang bde ba chen po'i tshul nyid du nye bar ston pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir yang rgyud gzhan rnams su zla ba la sogs pa'i rim pas rnam pa lnga mngon par byang chub pa gsungs na yang bde ba chen po'i tshul nyid du nye bar ston pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, even though in other tantras the five aspects are taught by the stages of the moon, etc., they are not taught as the method of great bliss.

original: rnam pa 'di lta bu'i rnal 'byor dang rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud rnams kho nar ni bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin rdo rje 'dzin pa'i sa yongs su gsal zhing de'i rjes su 'brang ba las gzhan du yang rtogs par bya'i /
analyzed: rnam pa 'di lta bu'i rnal 'byor dang rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud rnams kho nar ni bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin rdo rje 'dzin pa'i sa yongs su gsal zhing de'i rjes su 'brang ba las gzhan du yang rtogs par bya'i /
translated: In the Yoga and Yogini Tantras of this kind, the stage of Vajradhara, which is of the nature of great bliss, is clearly taught, and it should be understood that it is to be attained by following that.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i dbang med par nye bar bstan pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i dbang med par nye bar bstan pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not taught that it is to be attained without the initiation of the birth of coemergence.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' kho nas so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' kho nas so //

analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i dbang ni rnam pa 'di lta bu'i rgyud rnams kho nar ro //
translated: The initiation of the birth of coemergence is in the tantras of this kind.

original: rgyu rdo rje 'dzin pa med par 'bras bu rdo rje 'dzin pa bskyed pa ma yin no zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: rgyu rdo rje 'dzin pa med par 'bras bu rdo rje 'dzin pa bskyed pa ma yin no zhes gsungs pa /
translated: It is not taught that the result, the stage of Vajradhara, is produced without the cause, the stage of Vajradhara.

translated: This is stated in the verse beginning with ‚Äúali.‚Äù

analyzed: gdan ni gdan no //

analyzed: 'dir mi sbyor pa'i phyir ro zhes pa lhag ma'o //

analyzed: sems pa'i gzugs las byung ba zhes pa bshad ma thag pa'i rgyu rdo rje 'dzin ba las skyes pa'o //
translated: The form born from the mind is born from the cause Vajradhara just explained.

original: dkyil 'khor dbang mo zhes pa bdag med ma'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor dbang mo zhes pa bdag med ma'o //
translated: The queen of the mandala is Nairatmya.

analyzed: 'di skad gsungs te ye shes bzhi rnams ni rgyur gyur pa rnams te /

analyzed: lnga pa 'bras bu'i zhes pa'o //

original: de ci 'bras bu rdo rje 'dzin pa ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin med dam zhe na /üîΩde ltar ma yin te 'di rnams shin tu rnam par dag pa rnams de'i ngo bor skye ba'i phyir yin zhing /
analyzed: de ci 'bras bu rdo rje 'dzin pa ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin med dam zhe na / de ltar ma yin te 'di rnams shin tu rnam par dag pa rnams de'i ngo bor skye ba'i phyir yin zhing /
translated: One may say: But are not the result vajra-holders, the nature of the five pristine awarenesses, absent?

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bzhin du bla mas sngon du rtogs su gzhug par bya'o zhes mngon par dgongs pas so //

analyzed: zla ba chu shel nor bu ni mtshan ma med pa'i zla ba gang ba lta bu ste /

analyzed: gang las med do dang yod do la sogs pa'i spros pa spangs pa'o //

original: dag pa de yang lus dang ngag dang sems kyi ngo bo gzugs la sogs pa ni gcad du med pa ste mi rtag pa la sogs pa spyi'i mtshan nyid tha dad pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dag pa de yang lus dang ngag dang sems kyi ngo bo gzugs la sogs pa ni gcad du med pa ste mi rtag pa la sogs pa spyi'i mtshan nyid tha dad pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: That purity is the nature of body, speech, and mind, which is not divisible because of the difference of general characteristics such as impermanence and so on.

original: dbyer med pa ste gzugs su rung ba la sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid tha dad med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dbyer med pa ste gzugs su rung ba la sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid tha dad med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is indivisible because of the nondifference of its particular characteristics such as suitability for form and so on.

original: gzung ba med pa ste /
analyzed: gzung ba med pa ste /
translated: It is ungraspable.

original: sems 'di kho na lus dang ngag gi rnam pa snang ba'i lus la sogs pa zhes bya ba gzung bar bya ba ni yod pa ma yin pas so //
analyzed: sems 'di kho na lus dang ngag gi rnam pa snang ba'i lus la sogs pa zhes bya ba gzung bar bya ba ni yod pa ma yin pas so //
translated: This mind alone is the body, speech, and so on, which appear in the form of body and so on. There is no apprehended object.

original: 'di ltar gyur pa'i lus la sogs pa las logs pa 'dzin pa po gzhan sems yod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gyur pa'i lus la sogs pa las logs pa 'dzin pa po gzhan sems yod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Apart from the body and so on, which are like that, there is no other mind, the apprehender, which exists.

original: gzung ba med na de 'dzin pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzung ba med na de 'dzin pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if there is no apprehended object, there is no apprehender.

original: de ltar na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba'i stong pa nyid du ro gcig pa phan tshun tha mi dad pa'i lus dang ngag dang sems ni byang chub kyi sems su brjod cing /
analyzed: de ltar na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba'i stong pa nyid du ro gcig pa phan tshun tha mi dad pa'i lus dang ngag dang sems ni byang chub kyi sems su brjod cing /
translated: Thus, the body, speech, and mind, which are of one taste in emptiness, free from apprehended object and apprehending subject, and mutually undifferentiated, are called the thought of awakening.

original: de kho na yang chos kyi sku dang phung po med pa ste rgyu la 'bras bu nye bar btags pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: de kho na yang chos kyi sku dang phung po med pa ste rgyu la 'bras bu nye bar btags pa'i phyir ro /
translated: That is also the dharma body and the absence of aggregates, because the result is figuratively designated in the cause.

original: sgrib pa dang bcas pa'i phung po lnga'i ngo bo phung po gnas gzhan du gyur pa'i bar ma chad du yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrib pa dang bcas pa'i phung po lnga'i ngo bo phung po gnas gzhan du gyur pa'i bar ma chad du yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the nature of the five aggregates with afflictions exists uninterruptedly until the transformation of the aggregates.

original: rdo rje'i bdag nyid yang dag par byung ba ni lus dang ngag dang sems rdo rje'i rang gi ngo bor skyes pa ste /
analyzed: rdo rje'i bdag nyid yang dag par byung ba ni lus dang ngag dang sems rdo rje'i rang gi ngo bor skyes pa ste /
translated: The one who has arisen as the nature of the vajra is born in the nature of the vajra of body, speech, and mind.

original: byang chub kyi sems la yang thog ma dang tha ma med na yang /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems la yang thog ma dang tha ma med na yang /
translated: Although the thought of enlightenment is without beginning and end,

original: mngon du byed pa'i gnas skabs @116b na yang kun rdzob tu skyes par brjod do //
analyzed: mngon du byed pa'i gnas skabs @116b na yang kun rdzob tu skyes par brjod do //
translated: it is said that it is born in the state of realization, even conventionally.

original: de nyid kyi phyir nye bar sdud de /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir nye bar sdud de /
translated: Therefore, it is summarized.

original: de ltar rdo rje'i sku bla na med pa zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar rdo rje'i sku bla na med pa zhes pa ste /
translated: Thus, the unexcelled vajra body.

original: 'dis kyang sku'i gsang ba sgrub pa'i zur gyis ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces 'chad par 'gyur ba'i dpe'i ngo bo chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin 'bras bu'i byang chub kyi sems kyang gsal bar byas so //
analyzed: 'dis kyang sku'i gsang ba sgrub pa'i zur gyis ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces 'chad par 'gyur ba'i dpe'i ngo bo chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin 'bras bu'i byang chub kyi sems kyang gsal bar byas so //
translated: This also indirectly establishes the secret of the body, and it also clarifies the thought of enlightenment as the result, which is the nature of the truth body, the meaning of the example, which will be explained as ‚Äúall tathƒÅgatas.‚Äù

original: de nyid kyi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rnams byang chub kyi sems nyid du rtogs nas dpe can rtogs pa'i ched du 'dri ba ni /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rnams byang chub kyi sems nyid du rtogs nas dpe can rtogs pa'i ched du 'dri ba ni /
translated: Therefore, having realized the bodies, speech, and minds of all tathƒÅgatas as the thought of enlightenment, the question is asked for the sake of realizing the example.

original: slar yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: slar yang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Again, the verse says:üîΩ

original: rdo rje de ni gang lus dang ngag dang sems kyi bdag nyid du gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje de ni gang lus dang ngag dang sems kyi bdag nyid du gsungs pa'o //
translated: Again, the vajra is that which is said to be the nature of body, speech, and mind.

original: 'o na skad cig gcig gis mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i gnas skabs 'dir yang rdo rje lta bu'i bar chad med pa'i lam gyi ngo bor gyur pa na /
analyzed: 'o na skad cig gcig gis mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i gnas skabs 'dir yang rdo rje lta bu'i bar chad med pa'i lam gyi ngo bor gyur pa na /
translated: Now, at this stage of enlightenment in a single moment, it becomes the essence of the vajra-like uninterrupted path.

analyzed: gal te gzhan gyi gdams ngag la ltos nas mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par 'dod na /
translated: If it is asserted that enlightenment is dependent on the instructions of another,üîΩwhy is the Blessed One not posited as having wisdom without a teacher,

original: de ci bcom ldan 'das bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa nyid kyi phyir slob dpon med pa'i ye shes can du rnam par gzhag par bya ba ma yin zhing /
analyzed: de ci bcom ldan 'das bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa nyid kyi phyir slob dpon med pa'i ye shes can du rnam par gzhag par bya ba ma yin zhing /
translated: because the accumulations of merit and wisdom are completely fulfilled,

original: rang byung nyid du yang ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rang byung nyid du yang ma yin no zhe na /

analyzed: ma yin te rnam par gzhag par bya ba ma yin te /

analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i bsam pas rdo rje snying po'i dri ba 'di'o //

analyzed: de'i phyir 'di'i dri ba rigs so //

analyzed: de'i gnas skabs rtogs pa'i bar ma chad pa kho nar mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa ni slob dpon med pa kho na'o /
translated: Immediately after the stage of realization, he is fully enlightened, but only without a teacher.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sgra ni de'i rang gi ngo bo dang mtshungs pa'i dbang po nyid kyi don to //üîΩgang gi rdo rje gsum gyi bdag nyid rdo rje gsungs pa de nyid slar yang khyad par du 'chad par 'gyur ba'i phyag dang zhal la sogs pas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sgra ni de'i rang gi ngo bo dang mtshungs pa'i dbang po nyid kyi don to // gang gi rdo rje gsum gyi bdag nyid rdo rje gsungs pa de nyid slar yang khyad par du 'chad par 'gyur ba'i phyag dang zhal la sogs pas /
translated: The word ‚ÄútathƒÅgata‚Äù means the nature of the sense faculties, which are similar to his own nature.üîΩThe one whose nature is the three vajras, who is the vajra speech, again with the special hands, faces, etc.,üîΩwhich will be explained, with the form of Vajrasattva, with all the supreme aspects,

analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i gzugs me long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mchog dang ldan pa /

analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi bdag nyid /
translated: the very pure pristine awareness of the ultimate dimension of phenomena,

original: sangs rgyas kyi sku de @117a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sku de @117a * //
translated: the buddha body,

analyzed: bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang bdag nyid kyi dngos po mtshungs pa nyid du bsgom zhing sngags brjod do //
translated: One should meditate on the sameness of the nature of all the TathƒÅgatas and oneself, and recite the mantra.

analyzed: nye bar sdud pa lus kyi gsang ba zhes te /
translated: The summary is the secret of the body.

original: lus kyi ste zla ba dang zla ba'i sa bon gyi bdag nyid kyi ji skad bshad pa'i rang gi ngo bo ni gsang ba ste ;
analyzed: lus kyi ste zla ba dang zla ba'i sa bon gyi bdag nyid kyi ji skad bshad pa'i rang gi ngo bo ni gsang ba ste ;
translated: The body is the nature of the moon and the moon-seed, as explained, and the secret is

translated: The fifth is with ‚Äúreality,‚Äù etc.

analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa sangs rgyas lnga'i bdag nyid can nyid kyi phyir sangs rgyas kun bdag ste drug pa'o //
translated: The sixth is ‚Äúthe lord of all buddhas,‚Äù because of being the nature of the five buddhas, Vairochana, etc.

analyzed: bag chags dang bcas pa'i sgrib pa ma lus pa spangs pa las mchog tu bla na med pa'i dge ba nyid kyis na dge ba'o //
translated: The seventh is ‚Äúvirtuous,‚Äù because of being supremely unsurpassed virtue from the abandonment of all obscurations together with their instincts.

analyzed: 'di 'dra ba kho na'i mngon par byang chub pa rnam pa lnga pa rdzogs pa'i rim pas rdo rje sems dpa'i ngo bor rtogs par byed pa ni /
translated: This very kind of fivefold manifest enlightenment is the perfection stage, which causes one to realize the nature of Vajrasattva.

original: skye gnas dbus su rtsa gnyis dag / ces pa la sogs pas gsal bar byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye gnas dbus su rtsa gnyis dag / ces pa la sogs pas gsal bar byed par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: 'di kho na yang 'dir 'bras bu rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //

original: snga mas ni zla ba gnyis dang sa bon dang bcas pa'i phyag mtshan dang sprul pa rnams dang 'gro ba dang lhan cig ro gcig par gyur pa'i gnas skabs su rgyu rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //

translated: The former [enlightenment] is the causal Vajradhara, the state of the two moons, the hand implements together with the seed syllables, the emanations, and the state of oneness with the world.

original: de kho na yang 'dir skad cig gcig la mngon par byang chub pa rdo rje lta bu ste /
analyzed: de kho na yang 'dir skad cig gcig la mngon par byang chub pa rdo rje lta bu ste /

original: 'bras bu rdo rje 'dzin pa'i sa chos kyi sku'i bar chad med pa'i lam nyid kyis na chos kyi sku dang phung po med par brjod do ;
analyzed: 'bras bu rdo rje 'dzin pa'i sa chos kyi sku'i bar chad med pa'i lam nyid kyis na chos kyi sku dang phung po med par brjod do ;
translated: Since the resultant Vajradhara is the uninterrupted path of the dharmakƒÅya, the dharmakƒÅya is said to be without aggregates.

original: / de skad du yang 'phags pa sa bcu par gsungs pa /
analyzed: / de skad du yang 'phags pa sa bcu par gsungs pa /
translated: This is stated in the noble Ten Grounds:

original: sangs rgyas kyi yul rgya chen po la yang dag par gzhol ba dang / bsam pa ji lta bar sems can thams cad la yang dag par bstan cing tshim pa'i ched du zhes so //

translated: and they are engaged in the vast domain of the buddhas, and they are satisfied by teaching all beings in accordance with their aspirations.

original: 'dis ni rgyu yongs su dag pa ni rgya che ba'i sangs rgyas kyi yul la rab tu 'jug pa mngon par sgrub pa nyid kyis dang / 'bras bu dag pa ni bsam pa ji lta bar sems can la yang dag par ston cing tshim par byed pa nyid kyis te /

translated: Here, the cause is purified by the accomplishment of engagement in the vast domain of the buddhas, and the result is purified by teaching beings in accordance with their aspirations and satisfying them.

original: ye shes dang mthu dag gis zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ye shes dang mthu dag gis zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said that this is by means of knowledge and power.

original: de ltar ni @117b 'das pa'i srid pa'i gnas skabs bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshogs kyi sa ste /
analyzed: de ltar ni @117b 'das pa'i srid pa'i gnas skabs bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshogs kyi sa ste /
translated: Thus, the stage of the bodhisattvas accumulation is like the state of existence in the past.

original: yang dag par sog par chos mthun pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag par sog par chos mthun pa nyid kyi phyir ro //

original: 'dir ni sbyin pa la sogs pa bsod nams rnams sog cing /
analyzed: 'dir ni sbyin pa la sogs pa bsod nams rnams sog cing /
translated: Here, the accumulations of merit through generosity and so on are purified.

original: snga mar ni dge ba dang mi dge ba rnams so //
analyzed: snga mar ni dge ba dang mi dge ba rnams so //
translated: In the former, the virtuous and nonvirtuous are purified.

original: 'chi ba la mngon par phyogs par sbyor ba'i gnas skabs bzhin du mos pas spyod pa'i sa ste /
analyzed: 'chi ba la mngon par phyogs par sbyor ba'i gnas skabs bzhin du mos pas spyod pa'i sa ste /
translated: The stage of application is like the stage of approaching death.

original: de kho na nyid nges par 'byed pa'i sbyor ba'i ngo bo yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na nyid nges par 'byed pa'i sbyor ba'i ngo bo yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is the essence of the application that definitely issues forth in thatness.üîΩAfter that, like the stage of the intermediate existence that arises from the cessation of the previous existence, the stage of application ends in the final instant of the final moment of cessation.

original: de'i rjes su 'das pa'i srid pa 'gog pa las bar do'i srid pa'i gnas skabs bzhin du sbyor ba'i gnas skabs kyi mtha' nye'i skad cig gi mthar thug pa 'gog pa las mtha'i skad cig gi ngo bor rab tu dga' ba'i sa'i bar chad med pa'i lam gyiüîΩgnas skabs so //

translated: The stage of the uninterrupted path of the first ground is like the essence of the final instant.

original: de'i rjes su bar do'i srid pa ji lta ba bzhin gyi gzugs 'gags pa'i rjes kyi mngal gyi gnas skabs bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bar chad med pa'i lam 'gags pa'i rjes la sa bcu'i gnas skabs rig par bya ste /

translated: After that, like the stage of the womb that arises after the cessation of the form of the intermediate existence, the stage of the ten grounds should be known as the stage that arises after the cessation of the bodhisattvas‚Äô uninterrupted path.

original: sa 'di rnams sgrib pa dang bcas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sa 'di rnams sgrib pa dang bcas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because these grounds are associated with obscurations.

original: btsas pa'i gnas skabs dang 'dra ba ni sangs rgyas kyi gnas skabs te /
analyzed: btsas pa'i gnas skabs dang 'dra ba ni sangs rgyas kyi gnas skabs te /
translated: The state of Buddhahood is like the state of birth,

original: 'bras bu yongs su rdzogs pa nye bar bzung nas spyod yul thams cad so sor nyams su myong ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'bras bu yongs su rdzogs pa nye bar bzung nas spyod yul thams cad so sor nyams su myong ba'i phyir te /

analyzed: btsas pa ni dbang po thams cad kyi spyod yul so sor nyams su myong bas so //

analyzed: de nas bu la sogs pa skyod par byed pa'i gnas skabs dang 'dra ba ni sprul pa'i sku lha spro ba'i gnas skabs so //

original: de la mngal gyi gnas skabs bcu rnams te /
analyzed: de la mngal gyi gnas skabs bcu rnams te /

original: khu ba'i lus kyi gnas skabs dang / nur nur po'i lus kyi gnas skabs dang / ltar ltar po'i lus kyi gnas skabs dang / mkhrang gyur gyi lus kyi gnas skabs dang / lus dang rjes su mthun pa'i lus kyi gnas skabs dang / rang bzhin dang rjes su mthun pa'i lus kyi gnas skabs dang /

analyzed: las dang bcas pa'i lus kyi gnas skabs dang / yongs su rdzogs pa'i lus kyi gnas skabs rnam pa gsum ste / dbang po yongs @118a * //

analyzed: de rnams dang rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa rnams chos mthun pa nyid du nye bar mtshon par bya'o //

analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir phung po'i bdud las rgyal ba la yang 'di rab tu nus so // byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni rnam par rtog pa'i nyon mongs pa can no zhes pas ma dag pa'i nyon mongs pa dang las thams cad dang rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi bgegs la gnod pa byed pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa'i bdud las mchog tu rgyal
translated: For that very reason, he is also able to conquer the demon of the aggregates.üîΩSince the bodhisattvas are afflicted by conceptual thoughts, he is the terminator of obstacles that are characterized by all impure afflictions, karma, and conceptual thoughts.

original: ba ni bgegs mthar byed do //

original: 'dzin pa dngos po dmigs pa tsam dang / chags pa de la 'dun pa dang / rnam pa dngos po'i rnam par byed pa dang / g-yo med brtan par gyur pa'i reg pa dang / rgyu nyid rang dang rjes su mthun pa'i sems gzhan skye ba'i ngor dang /

analyzed: 'bras bu nyid rang dang rjes su mthun pa'i rgyu la ltos nas te /

original: de skad du yang 'dus pa phyi mar gsungs pa /

translated: Thus it is said in the Later GuhyasamƒÅja:

original: 'dzin dang chags pa nyid dang ni //
analyzed: 'dzin dang chags pa nyid dang ni //
translated: Grasping and attachment itself,

original: rnam pa de bzhin g-yo med pa //
analyzed: rnam pa de bzhin g-yo med pa //
translated: aspect, and likewise, without deceit,üîΩcause and result itself,

original: rgyu nyid dang ni 'bras bu nyid //

original: drug por sems yang dag 'byung ba //
analyzed: drug por sems yang dag 'byung ba //

analyzed: khro bo'i dbang po rnams zhes bsgrags / zhes so // rnam par rtog pa mi mthun phyogs ma lus pa zil gyis gnon pa'i @122a * //

original: 'dod pa ni 'dod par byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa ni 'dod par byed pa ste /
translated: Desire is that which is desired.

original: de rnam par dag pas na mngon par 'dod pa thob pas gsal ba'o zhes 'dod pa'i rgyal po'o //
analyzed: de rnam par dag pas na mngon par 'dod pa thob pas gsal ba'o zhes 'dod pa'i rgyal po'o //
translated: Since it is purified, it is clear by attaining the desired object.

original: sems can rnams kyi sdig pa ni sngon po ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi sdig pa ni sngon po ste /
translated: The sin of sentient beings is blue.

original: de dbyig pas 'debs par byed tshar gcod par byed do zhes pa dbyug pa sngon po'o //
analyzed: de dbyig pas 'debs par byed tshar gcod par byed do zhes pa dbyug pa sngon po'o //
translated: Since it is struck with a club, it is destroyed.

original: sems can rnams kyi nyon mongs pa'i phung po 'jig pa'i ched du 'di stobs te nus pa chen po'o zhes pa stobs po che'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi nyon mongs pa'i phung po 'jig pa'i ched du 'di stobs te nus pa chen po'o zhes pa stobs po che'o //
translated: For the sake of destroying the mass of afflictions of sentient beings, it is powerful, having great ability.

original: gtsug tor ni khams gsum pa las shin tu 'das pa stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: gtsug tor ni khams gsum pa las shin tu 'das pa stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i ye shes te /
translated: The crown is the gnosis of the indivisibility of emptiness and compassion, which is utterly beyond the three realms.

original: de 'khor lo bzhin du gdul bya rnams la bskor ba la 'di'i ngang tshul yin pa ni gtsug tor 'khor los sgyur ba'o //
analyzed: de 'khor lo bzhin du gdul bya rnams la bskor ba la 'di'i ngang tshul yin pa ni gtsug tor 'khor los sgyur ba'o //
translated: The one whose nature is to turn that [gnosis] like a wheel for the sake of those to be tamed is the Crown Victorious One.

original: bgegs rnams gnod pa ste 'jigs par byed pa bsal lo zhes pa gnod mdzes rgyal po'o //
analyzed: bgegs rnams gnod pa ste 'jigs par byed pa bsal lo zhes pa gnod mdzes rgyal po'o //

original: ye shes sems dpa' dam tshig sems dpa' la gzhug pa ste /
analyzed: ye shes sems dpa' dam tshig sems dpa' la gzhug pa ste /

original: de ni 'dir tha mal pa'i nga rgyal bsal bar rang gi sems snang ba'i ngo bo phyag la sogs pas rnam par mdzes pa'i lha'i sku'o //üîΩkha cig tu sa bon yang gsungs shing /

translated: That is the removal of ordinary pride, the essence of the appearance of one's mind, the deity's form beautified by the hand implements, and so on.üîΩIn some [sƒÅdhanas], the seed is also taught.

original: kha cig ni sa bon kho na'o //
analyzed: kha cig ni sa bon kho na'o //
translated: In some, it is only the seed.

original: de'i bdag nyid du mngon du byas pa'i gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir 'dir ye shes sems dpa' yang dag par 'gro'o 'du'o zhes pa dam tshig go //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid du mngon du byas pa'i gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir 'dir ye shes sems dpa' yang dag par 'gro'o 'du'o zhes pa dam tshig go //
translated: The pledge is that the gnosis being truly goes to and comes to the pledge being, because of the nature of the nondual gnosis that is actualized as its identity.

original: sems dpa' yang ste /
analyzed: sems dpa' yang ste /
translated: The pledge being is also the sattva being,

original: sems can gyi don byed pa nyid kyi phyir dang rnam par dag pa'i sems can gyi tha snyad kyi yul nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can gyi don byed pa nyid kyi phyir dang rnam par dag pa'i sems can gyi tha snyad kyi yul nyid kyi phyir ro //

original: sa bon yang nur nur po bzhin du sems can no //
analyzed: sa bon yang nur nur po bzhin du sems can no //

original: 'o na dam tshig sems dpa' ni ye shes sems dpa' dang ste kha cig tu sangs rgyas rnams thams cad dang / kha cig tu byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / kha cig tu 'gro ba dang yang lhan cig de'i bdag nyid du gsungs na ci ltar 'gal ba ma yin /

translated: If the pledge being is the gnosis being, and if the buddhas are said to be of the nature of both in some contexts, the bodhisattvas in some, and sentient beings in some, how is there no contradiction?
